page.title: 07BURROUGH GARDENS IN 1985
page.content: THE GARDENS VARY FROM SMALL TO SEVERAL ACRES AND ARE WELL MAINTAINES, MANY TO A HIGH STANDERD. SUBSQUENT TO THE MODERNISATION OR PREFABRICATED BUGALOWS, GARDENS HAVE BEEN LAID OUT BY MRLTON COUNCILWITH NEAT LAWNS AND COLOURFUL BORDERS. SOME OF THE LARGER GARDENS HAVE VERY EXTENSIVE LAWNS, THE VILLAGE STANDS ON A RIDGE, CONSISTING OF LIME OVER BOULDER CLAY WITH A SUFFICIENTLY HIGH LIME CONTENT TO MAKE IT UNSUITABLE FOR LIME-HATING SUBJECTS. IT IS HOWEVER OF HIGH FERTILITY AND ROSES DO PARTICULSRLY WELL.ASH IS A NATIVE TREE WITH GOOD HEDGEROW SPECIMENS. SOME OF THE LARGER GARDENS LAID OUT IN THE LATE 18TH & 19TH CENTURI ES WHICH REQUIRED QUICK GROWING WINDBREAKS AND SCREENS CONTAIN PLANTATIONS OF CONIFERS.
